This demo was too short, ignore my gameplay time I got busy somewhere else, resting my game in background.
Overall it is good detective game with seemingly a good well thought story, graphics.
Just requires the voice narration and a better hint system.

84375150.review:
Pretty casual story with some pretending concept with nothing extremely mindbreaking or innovating, but still interesing.
For anyone who want something similar - I'm giving you a NIGHT CALL (to tell you how I feel).
The demo is very, very short. For a moment I thought I was playing with my benis. 
Well, that's it, really. Game's interesting, game's free and it's a demo. Expect no great plot ATM.

82766051.review: A good mystery solving mechanic with an intriguing setting

82545766.review:
While this game is just a prototype/demo/prologue, it held it's ground very well as it made me expect and want more. So far, the story isn't too unique/niche or cliche, putting it at a good place to please a large audience. In terms of mechanics it's simple and user friendly, UI included. In terms of content, I like that you have to write things down, it's unique, at least to me it is. Also, there's a nice balance of giving you what you need and having to figure things out yourself. The only issue I had was that unless you figure something out, you're stuck in the apartment thinking with not much exploring available (again it's just a demo). In terms of visuals, if you're into the simplistic, easy on the eyes style, you'll love this. It's described as neo-noir and fittingly so, personally I really like the palette. 

tldr: It's simple, beautiful, and though-provoking. It's a free prologue, just play it and see what you think of it yourself.
